title: Giants co-owner Tisch named in latest Epstein file...
content: Giants co-owner Steve Tisch's name appears at least 440 times among millions of documents in the latest release of Jeffrey Epstein files Friday, including some that show Epstein connected him to numerous women.

title: Sources: Seahawks to go up for sale after SB LX
content: The Seattle Seahawks will go up for sale after Super Bowl LX, league and ownership sources familiar with the arrangement tell ESPN.

title: Bailey, with 10 games in NBA, seeks NCAA return
content: Former UCLA standout Amari Bailey, who played 10 games for the Hornets in 2023-24, has hired an agent and a lawyer to prepare to fight for NCAA eligibility.

title: Sources: Ravens to hire Doyle, 29, to be new OC
content: The Ravens are hiring Bears offensive coordinator Declan Doyle as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter. Doyle, 29, will be the youngest offensive playcaller in the NFL.

title: Wilson, A's reach agreement on 7-year extension
content: All-Star shortstop Jacob Wilson and the Athletics reached agreement on a seven-year contract that includes a club option for an eighth season, the team announced Friday.

title: Wilder-Chisora bout set for April in London
content: Former WBC heavyweight champion Deontay Wilder will face Derek Chisora on April 4 at O2 Arena in London, it was announced Friday.

title: Inter Miami signs Berterame to long-term DP deal
content: Inter Miami signed Mexico national team forward Germ√°n Berterame from Monterrey as a designated player with a contract through the 2028-29 MLS season.

content: Retired NASCAR driver Greg Biffle was not flying his own jet when it crashed last month, killing him and six others, according to an NTSB report.

content: The NFL has stood by its decision to book Bad Bunny for the Super Bowl halftime show despite criticism from the Trump administration.

content: In 2016, Shakur Stevenson and Teofimo Lopez Jr. sparred at a Miami gym. On Saturday, they fight for much more.

content: After five days of shakedown testing at Barcelona, ESPN's F1 analysts reveal what they learned about the state of the field ahead of 2026 rule changes.

title: Chase Elliott is finding his way back to where he ...
content: Last year was the first time Chase Elliott won multiple races in a season since 2022. Can he carry that momentum into the 2026 campaign?

title: What to do with Giannis? The best- and worst-case ...
content: With Giannis Antetokounmpo rumored to be in his final days with Milwaukee, Andre Snellings takes a look at the possible destinations and which would be best and worst for his fantasy value.

title: Pawar play: Speedy decision on Sunetra as deputy CM to pre-empt takeover by NCP (SP)?
content: Sunetra Pawar's appointment as deputy chief minister is a strategic move by senior NCP leaders to preemptively quell leadership speculation following her husband's passing. This decision, endorsed by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, aims to stabilize the political landscape before the potential merger of NCP factions, ensuring control amidst potential demands from Sharad Pawar's camp.

title: Trump administration to add roughly 65,000 H-2B guest worker visas this year
content: The Trump administration is releasing an additional 65,000 H-2B seasonal guest worker visas, nearly doubling the annual allocation. This move aims to alleviate financial hardship for businesses in sectors like hospitality and construction, which have reported labor shortages. The decision comes amidst broader immigration policies and follows similar visa expansions under previous administrations.

title: 'Gambhir under lot of pressure': Bavuma fires warning at India head coach
content: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma believes Indian coach Gautam Gambhir faces significant pressure in Test cricket, despite white-ball successes. Bavuma suggests Gambhir needs time to navigate the team's transition, with limited-overs strength potentially offering breathing room. He advocates for continuity in coaching roles, backing Gambhir through the challenging red-ball period.

title: Delhi man critical after taking HIV preventive drugs on AI advice
content: A man in Delhi is battling a severe health crisis after taking HIV post-exposure medication without a prescription, guided by an AI chatbot. This reckless decision led to a rare and serious condition known as Stevens-Johnson syndrome.

title: Catherine O'Hara, 'Home Alone' and 'Schitt's Creek' actress, passes away at 71
content: With deep sadness, we announce the passing of the beloved Canadian actress Catherine O'Hara at the age of 71, following a short illness. Renowned for her unforgettable performances in iconic films like 'Home Alone' and the hit series 'Schitt's Creek,' Catherine's talent blossomed over an impressive career that spanned five decades.

title: Elon Musk says Tesla's future is not in cars; names China as its only real rival
content: Elon Musk envisions Tesla's future beyond cars, shifting focus to humanoid robots. The company plans to convert Model S and X production lines into Optimus robot factories, aiming for a million units annually. Musk also identified China as the primary competitor in this burgeoning market, acknowledging their manufacturing and AI prowess.

title: From bricks to blockbusters: How CJ Roy turned Bengaluru‚Äôs fringe into fortune
content: CJ Roy transformed from managing his mother's real estate accounts to becoming a wealthy developer by betting on overlooked land along Sarjapur Road. This foresight, honed by early exposure to property transactions, led him to launch Confident Group and capitalize on Bengaluru's tech boom, achieving spectacular returns.

title: Epstein Files: Justice department temporarily removes document related to Trump and Jeffrey
content: The Justice Department briefly released and re-published a file containing FBI complaint summaries mentioning Jeffrey Epstein and Donald Trump.  These unverified complaints, some dating back 35 years, also referenced Bill Clinton and Lisa Marie Presley.  Notably, some complainants provided no contact details, and one email indicated second-hand information was included.

title: After T20 World Cup exit, BCB reveals Shakib's roadmap for next ICC tournament
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board is planning Shakib Al Hasan's return to the national team.  The veteran all-rounder could play in the upcoming series against Pakistan.  Batting coach Mohammad Ashraful believes Shakib should aim for the 2027 ODI World Cup.  Shakib's personal security and legal issues are being addressed.  His comeback is a significant development for Bangladesh cricket.

title: Amazon HR head's 'message' for employees on layoffs: As we always have, every team will‚Ä¶
content: Amazon HR chief Beth Galetti told employees the company won't announce mass layoffs every few months‚Äîthough individual teams will keep making staffing "adjustments as appropriate." The careful wording follows 16,000 job cuts earlier this week and 14,000 in October last year. Company's top leadership framed the job cuts as part of CEO Andy Jassy's push to operate like the "world's largest startup," suggesting ongoing changes despite promises of no regular cuts.

title: ‚ÄòI-T officials solely responsible for CJ Roy‚Äôs death,‚Äô says Bengaluru real estate tycoon‚Äôs brother
content: Confident Group owner CJ Roy tragically died by suicide, with his family accusing Kerala income tax officials of causing immense pressure and harassment.  Roy's brother alleged repeated scrutiny despite his claims of compliance, leading to unbearable stress. The family plans to discuss filing a complaint against the officials involved.

title: Musk took final minutes of Tesla's earnings call to warn American companies about ...
content: Elon Musk issued a strong warning to American companies, urging them to invest in domestic battery manufacturing infrastructure or risk falling behind. He highlighted geopolitical risks associated with fragile supply chains for critical EV materials, emphasizing Tesla's own significant investments in lithium refining and battery production facilities in Texas to mitigate these vulnerabilities.

title: ‚ÄòBorder 2‚Äô Box Office: Deol‚Äôs film leads with Rs 235 crore
content: The war epic 'Border 2' has achieved a remarkable feat, crossing the Rs 200 crore mark within its first week. Early estimates suggest an Rs 11 crore collection on its 8th day, pushing the total earnings to an impressive Rs 235.25 crores.  Despite facing competition from 'Mardaani 3', the film continues to draw audiences, with Jaipur showing strong occupancy.

title: 'Cops can't play role of judiciary': HC slams UP police on encounters
content: The Allahabad High Court has strongly criticized UP Police for frequent encounters, particularly below-the-knee shootings, citing a disregard for judicial authority.  Justice Arun Kumar Singh Deshwal mandated specific guidelines for all police-criminal encounters, emphasizing that punishment is the judiciary's role, not the police's.  Failure to comply will be treated as contempt.

title: Gabrielle Union opens up on nearly ending marriage over fertility struggles
content: Dwyane Wade and his wife, the popular actress Gabrielle Union, have had a beautiful and a healthy marriage ever since they tied the knot in 2014 after dating for a couple of years. While both Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union had been through divorce before, the popular actress did not have a biological child of her own unlike the NBA legend. As the two tried to expand their family, Gabrielle Union details the trauma she faced as she failed to conceive.

title: Kayla Nicole opens up as Taylor Swift‚ÄìTravis Kelce wedding faces doubt
content: Travis Kelce's ex girlfriend, the popular social media influencer Kayla Nicole, has made a pretty emotional confession about her life as the Kansas City Chiefs' star player and Taylor Swift is reportedly planning to delay their wedding. At this point in time, Travis Kelce is facing strong retirement rumors while Taylor Swift is involved in a scandalous legal trouble with her Hollywood friends.

title: NHL trade rumors: Artemi Panarin seeks $50m extension, complicates talks
content: Star player Artemi Panarin seeks a massive $50 million contract extension. This demand complicates his potential trade from the New York Rangers. Several teams have expressed interest in acquiring Panarin. The Florida Panthers are reportedly a top choice for the player. Panarin is in the final year of his current contract. His future team will be decided soon.

title: Sunetra Pawar set to take oath as Maharashtra deputy CM today
content: Sunetra Pawar is poised to become Maharashtra's deputy chief minister, a historic first for the state. Following her husband Ajit Pawar's tragic passing, the Rajya Sabha MP is expected to be sworn in on Saturday. Her elevation to the deputy CM post may necessitate a contest for the Baramati by-election.

title: Epstein files: Did Musk plan to visit Epstein‚Äôs private island? Here‚Äôs what new documents reveal
content: New documents reveal Elon Musk's communications with Jeffrey Epstein. Emails show Musk inquiring about visiting Epstein's island during the holidays. Epstein invited Musk, suggesting dates in early January. The documents indicate a level of contact previously unknown. Musk had previously stated he refused Epstein's invitations to the island.

title: Foul air causing deaths in India? 'Yes', 'can't say': 2 govt arms take differing stands
content: Divergent views from governmental bodies regarding air pollution are creating waves. The Environment Ministry argues that there's a lack of decisive evidence tying pollution to actual deaths, while the Indian Council of Medical Research puts forth alarming statistics, claiming over 1.2 million fatalities in 2017 due to air quality issues.

title: ‚ÄòNo work, no school, no shopping‚Äô: Protests erupt across US against Trump's immigration crackdown
content: Nationwide protests erupted against the Trump administration's immigration policies, fueled by recent fatal shootings linked to enforcement.  Organizers called for a "no work, no school, no shopping" strike.  Hundreds gathered in Minneapolis, while schools in Arizona and Colorado cancelled classes. Businesses also participated, with some donating to immigrant support groups, highlighting widespread concern over the human impact of these policies.

title: By March 31, transfer land for fencing of border: Calcutta HC to Bengal
content: The Calcutta High Court has ordered the Bengal government to transfer land parcels to the BSF by March 31 for fencing the India-Bangladesh border. This directive follows a PIL highlighting national security threats from unfenced border stretches. The court will also consider emergency land acquisition for pending proposals.

title: Epstein files: US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick planned visit to Jeffrey‚Äôs private island
content: Newly released Justice Department documents reveal Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick planned a 2012 visit to Jeffrey Epstein's private island, years after claiming to have severed ties. Lutnick inquired about visiting Epstein's island for a meal with his family and another family. The documents also indicate continued contact and shared interests between Lutnick and Epstein in later years.

title: ‚ÄòDear G‚Äô: Is Melania Trump mentioned in the Epstein files, and who is ‚ÄòG‚Äô?
content: Newly released Jeffrey Epstein investigation files reveal alleged email exchanges between Ghislaine Maxwell and Melania Trump from 2002. The correspondence, predating her marriage to Donald Trump, discusses a New York magazine story and travel plans. Neither the Trumps have been accused of any wrongdoing in connection with the Epstein case.

title: Uttarakhand UCC amendment brings 7-year jail for forced marriages, live-ins
content: Uttarakhand's Uniform Civil Code (Amendment) Ordinance introduces stringent penalties, including up to seven years imprisonment, for offences related to marriage and live-in relationships. The amendments aim to clarify provisions, enhance effectiveness, and strengthen citizen rights, incorporating stricter punishment clauses following the implementation of new criminal laws.

title: 'Mardaani 3' Box Office, day 1: Thriller opens with over Rs 3 crores
content: Mardaani 3 has kicked off its box office run with a respectable Rs 3.80 crore opening day. Rani Mukerji shines as the formidable cop Shivani Shivaji Roy, earning widespread praise for her powerful performance. The film, directed by Abhiraj Minawala, saw increasing audience occupancy throughout its first day, indicating a promising start for the franchise.

title: ‚ÄòThey do want to make a deal‚Äô: Trump says Iran ready for nuclear talks ‚Äî how Tehran responded
content: President Trump stated Iran is ready for a deal to avert US military action, though he did not reveal a deadline for talks. Iran's foreign minister countered that negotiations require equal footing and mutual respect, emphasizing that its missile capabilities are not up for discussion.  Turkey has offered to mediate.

title: Why was Kwesi Adofo-Mensah fired? Explaining the Vikings‚Äô GM change
content: The Minnesota Vikings have surprisingly fired General Manager Kwesi Adofo-Mensah after four seasons, despite a recent contract extension. The team cited "best interest of the team" for the leadership change following a disappointing 2025 season. Executive VP Rob Brzezinski will lead front office operations through the upcoming NFL Draft as the search for a new GM begins.

title: Blazers vs Knicks injury report: Playing status, injuries & stats
content: The New York Knicks, on a four-game winning streak and near full strength, host an injury-plagued Portland Trail Blazers team struggling with a three-game losing skid.  Portland's depleted guard rotation faces a significant challenge against New York's size and defensive prowess.  Turnovers and execution are expected to be key factors in this Madison Square Garden clash.

title: Trump thinks giant US winter storm exposed global warming 'con': How he got it completely wrong
content: Chilly weather moments might spark doubt about climate change, but research consistently shows our planet is heating up. Even with brief cold spells, the overall temperature is on the rise, resulting in ice melt, higher sea levels, and erratic weather patterns. The primary culprits? Our reliance on fossil fuels.

title: Chloe Kim shares heartbreak as Myles Garrett stands by her side
content: The Cleveland Browns' star player, Myles Garrett, has been a strong source of support and strength to his girlfriend, the two time Olympian Chloe Kim, as she gears up for the 2026 Winter Olympics in Italy. While Chloe Kim seems fully focused on her prep, she ended up sustaining a brutal shoulder injury, just days ago. The popular 25 year old Olympian now opens up about her frustrations.

title: Bengal SIR: Former India footballer receives EC summon, says 'no choice but to appear'
content: Former footballer Mehtab Hossain will appear before the Election Commission regarding electoral roll discrepancies, citing a potential issue with his mother's name. He expressed concerns about the sudden and unplanned nature of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) process. The ruling TMC criticized the summoning of sportspersons, calling it BJP's paranoia and an attempt at harassment.

title: Magh Mela row: Seer ups the ante, makes 2 big demands; asks CM to prove he is 'Hindu sympathiser'
content: Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati has asked UP CM  Yogi Adityanath to stop beef exports from the state and declare the cow as ‚ÄòRajya Mata‚Äô. He emphasized that such steps would prove the chief minister‚Äôs commitment as a ‚ÄúHindu sympathiser‚Äù. The seer further stated that  he had staged a sit-in protest for 11 days after the incident but left the Magh Mela ground last Wednesday ‚Äúwith a heavy heart‚Äù.

title: Australian Open 2026: Surely you are (D)joking, Mr Novak?
content: The term GOAT is thrown around with wanton abandon these days, but no GOAT has been as persistently questioned as Novak.

title: Panama court voids CK Hutchison port contracts: Why it's a win for Trump, setback for Xi
content: Panama's Supreme Court has voided a major Panama Canal ports contract held by a Chinese-linked firm, a significant win for the 'Donroe Doctrine'. This ruling aligns with US efforts to curb Chinese influence over strategic trade routes, complicating Beijing's global commercial footprint and reinforcing US leverage. The decision stems from alleged irregularities, though its geopolitical implications are profound.

title: Yuzvendra Chahal reacts to viral AI Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 3 posters
content: AI-generated posters of Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 3 featuring Yuzvendra Chahal began circulating widely on social media. The visuals cheekily placed the cricketer alongside Dhanashree Verma, RJ Mahvash, and Bigg Boss 13 contestant Shefali Bagga, mirroring the multiple-romance chaos associated with the Kapil Sharma franchise.

title: 'Angoor khatte hai': Piyush Goyal rips into 'negative mindset' of Congress; pans UPA-era FTA deals
content: Union minister Piyush Goyal defended the India-EU FTA, dismissing Congress criticism as 'sour grapes' and highlighting the party's past inaction. He accused Congress of endangering India's interests by pushing for China-centric trade pacts, contrasting it with the current government's balanced approach. Goyal also lauded India's economic growth and the FTA's geopolitical significance.

title: India‚Äôs role in shaping global thinking on patient safety highlighted at Apollo Hospitals International Health Dialogue 2026
content: The international conference brought together doctors, policymakers, digital health professionals and experts to discuss ways to build safer and more equitable healthcare systems

title: Expectations from a gender lens in Budget 2026-27
content: What the Budget could do to unlock women‚Äôs time, productivity, and participation in India‚Äôs growth story

title: Regime in tough spot as every Iranian has been affected by economic collapse, says Scott Anderson
content: Journalist and writer Scott Anderson says, unlike during earlier protests in Iran, the regime can no longer play one group off against another, because everyone is suffering; the economic collapse, food and water crises, and high unemployment rate cannot all be blamed on foreign saboteurs, he adds

title: Stalin set to visit Sivaganga district
content: The CM is also scheduled to take part in the centenary celebrations of Thavathiru Kundrakkudi Adigalar, an official release said

title: Vande Mataram should be sung in its entirety across the country: K. Annamalai
content: At an event organised by Tamil Perayam, he read out the later stanzas of the poem and a Tamil translation of them

title: PDP‚Äôs Parra introduces ‚ÄòJ&K Reconciliation, Trauma Healing and Dignity‚Äô Bill in Assembly
content: According to the Bill, J&K has witnessed prolonged violence, armed conflict, terrorism and political instability, resulting in widespread psychological trauma, displacement, grief, loss of dignity and erosion of social trust

title: 2026 UGC equity rules: Cracks on campus
content: Students from the general category or upper castes believe that the UGC‚Äôs 2026 regulations, introduced mainly to address caste discrimination on campuses, will create a divide and villainise them. They worry about several of its provisions, including the lack of protection against false complaints. While the Supreme Court has stayed the regulations, anger has not yet subsided, report Abhinay Lakshman and Mayank Kumar

title: BJP MLA confronts U.P. Minister over delayed water projects in Mahoba, video went viral
content: After the video of the incident went viral, the Samajwadi Party (SP) president Akhilesh Yadav targeted the BJP government, alleging that BJP ministers or MLAs are busy making money and grabbing land, with none of them are working for the public or for development needs.

title: Challenges stacked against Sunetra Pawar, who will take charge in a turbulent political scenario, amid a flux in two parties
content: For the NCP, it is now a battle for survival, where the legislators and cadres will not find any other face acceptable as a leadership option

title: Indian-origin printing firm boss convicted of COVID loan fraud in U.K.
content: Prashant Jobanputra is said to have ‚Äúfraudulently declared‚Äù on the second application that this was the only Bounce Back Loan he had applied for.

title: Rajasthan Assembly witnesses heated exchanges over ‚ÄòSIR irregularities‚Äô issue
content: When the House reassembled, Mr. Jully requested that a half-hour discussion on the allegations of SIR irregularities be allowed in the light of a debate on electoral reforms held in Lok Sabha recently.

title: A soldier few know, a record few can match: Brigadier Henry Bhaskar‚Äôs journey through two wars and beyond
content: A frontline officer in the 1965 and 1971 wars, Brigadier Bhaskar went on to become the first chairman of the Chittagong Port Trust in newly liberated Bangladesh after leading Indian troops into the strategic harbour city

title: When the sea became a shared responsibility for scientists and people living along the coast
content: Over the past two decades, INCOIS‚Äôs Wave Monitoring Along Nearshore (WAMAN) buoy network has been transforming India‚Äôs coastal forecasting by combining science with community trust. With 17 nearshore buoys and active local participation, WAMAN delivers real-time wave data that strengthens early warnings, supports fishers and ports, and ensures long-term, sustainable ocean observation

title: AI171 crash probe: AAIB assessing various aspects; nothing has been ruled out, says source
content: According to a report on January 30, the probe might be leaning towards deliberate pilot action as the probable cause for the accident

title: How can State government squat on private property, asks Madras High Court Chief Justice
content: Denies interim relief to the government in a case related to rental dispute between Tambaram Police Commissionerate and its landlords

title: Maharashtra Zilla Parishad elections postponed to February 7: SEC
content: According to the SEC, the Supreme Court has allowed an extension of two weeks for these elections beyond January 31

title: Will waive cooperative society loans for persons with disabilities, promises Palaniswami
content: He also asserts that the issue has not been resolved in the DMK-led front, with the Congress drifting from the alliance

title: SIR in Bengal: Cricketer Jhulan Goswami summoned for hearing
content: The matter triggered a sharp political reaction, with the Trinamool Congress accusing the BJP of targeting a national sports icon

title: NGT warns action against officers for lapses on curbing illegal mining
content: The NGT also directed the Director, Geology and Mining, Uttar Pradesh and the Member Secretary, UPPCB, to ensure that the directions given by the tribunal in other connected cases are strictly followed, and inspection is also carried out by an Expert Committee at least thrice for each lease

title: In a ‚Äòfirst‚Äô for PMK, Anbumani interviews ticket aspirants
content: Sources say the interviews have created a buzz among the aspirants, who have had a chance to meet with the leadership and speak about their work within the party

title: Venezuela's acting President Rodriguez dials PM Modi, agrees to take bilateral ties to new heights
content: ‚ÄúWe agreed to further deepen and expand our bilateral partnership in all areas, with a shared vision of taking India-Venezuela relations to new heights in the years ahead,‚Äù PM Modi said

title: Supreme Court sets aside Madras HC order asking accused to marry for bail
content: Advocates representing the accused-petitioner submitted before the apex court that asking their client to actually marry the woman, even before the charges were proved against him, would amount to pre-judging the allegation that he had made the promise of wedlock

title: ED arrests former RCom director Punit Garg
content: The arrest was made on Thursday (January 29, 2026) as part of the ED probe with respect to a First Information Report registered by the Central Bureau of Investigation

title: Phone tapping case: KCR asked to be available for questioning on February 1
content: The police declined to conduct the examination at his farmhouse, saying the venue must correspond to the ordinary place of residence in official records

title: Uttarakhand-like attacks forcing Kashmir youth to look inwards: Omar Abdullah
content: ‚ÄúWe have seen what our people have faced outside in recent times, whether it was in Himachal Pradesh or what happened recently in Uttarakhand. As a result, our people are now looking inward rather than going outside,‚Äù said J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah

title: CBFC files caveat in Supreme Court in Jana Nayagan case
content: A caveat is filed by a litigant in the High Courts and the Supreme Court to ensure that no adverse order is passed against it without it being heard

title: Bangladeshi national arrested in Agartala allegedly involved in human trafficking
content: The detainee reportedly confessed to his involvement in trafficking Bangladeshi nationals through different border routes

title: 2-year Central deputation at SP/DIG level must for IPS officers to be eligible for senior posts: MHA
content: The MHA writes to States that a minimum of two years of Central experience at SP/DIG or equivalent level will be mandatory for empanelment of IPS officers at IG/equivalent level at the Centre from the 2011 batch onwards.

title: Unions question apex court‚Äôs comment linking aggressive unionism to industrial stagnation
content: These observations of the Supreme Court coupled with its refusal to entertain a plea seeking minimum wages for domestic workers, are deeply concerning, the AITUC said

title: Samyukt Kisan Morcha set to campaign against India-EU trade deal
content: The opening of the processed food market will have a larger and disastrous impact on domestic agricultural production and small farmers, the Samyukt Kisan Morcha says in a statement

title: Resurvey 2.0 should be error free, says A.P. Revenue Minister
content: Minister says government has extended timeline to 140 days to allow thorough verification, instructs officials to actively involve landowners at every stage and defer surveys if farmers concerned are not present

title: Karnataka bans tobacco-related advertisements on RTC buses after public backlash
content: The decision comes amid growing protests by Kannada activists in Bengaluru and other parts of the state who have recently been removing tobacco-related advertisements from RTC buses.

title: High tap coverage under Jal Jeevan scheme, but lower usage, reliability
content: Water flowed through taps in only 83% of households, and only 76% had water that met standards for e-coli, faecal coliform, pH levels

title: Bihar Govt. to cover entire fees for SC & ST students enrolled in NIT, IIT, AIIMS, NIFT and CIMP
content: The State Government also increased the annual fee paid by the department to SC and ST students in non government institutions in the state

title: A.P. rejects Telangana‚Äôs demand for 50:50 sharing of Krishna waters
content: Pointing out that diversion surplus water from Polavaram project will not harm the upper riparian States, A.P. urges CWC to issue clear allocation guidelines

title: PMK founder Ramadoss files case against son Anbumani‚Äôs claim before Madras High Court
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan are slated to hear his writ petition on February 2, 2026

title: Lokesh urges Centre to permit CSR funding for R&D in institutions
content: Nearly twenty experts have been consulted at Davos to build an ecosystem supporting Quantum Valley proposed in Andhra Pradesh, said Mr. Lokesh during ‚ÄòHello Lokesh‚Äô programme

title: Coastal high-tide flooding declared State-specific disaster
content: Financial assistance similar to that provided to natural disaster victims under the State Disaster Response Fund norms will be given to those affected

title: Breakaway Jamaat-e-Islami faction in Kashmir claims recognition by ECI, pledges to ‚Äòwork within Constitutional framework‚Äô
content: India and Pakistan are two nuclear states and will resolve issues through dialogue, and J&K has no role in it, says JDF-J&K chief patron Ghulam Qadir Lone

title: Kerala for All: 2-day conclave will focus on inclusive tourism
content: Policymakers, industry leaders, designers, economists, accessibility practitioners, and travellers will share the stage on the first day as it will bring together policy intent, expert perspectives, lived experience, and design practice to debate on the central question of what it will take to make tourism truly inclusive.

title: Sunetra Pawar set to be first woman Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra
content: CM says government will support NCP decision; Parth Pawar likely to replace his mother as a Rajya Sabha MP; reunification not a priority, says NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal, even as some NCP-SP leaders push for it

title: BRS spreading lies on govt. efforts to protect State‚Äôs rightful share in river water: Uttam
content: The Minister for Irrigation says Centra has not given any clearance to PNLP so far incl. for its pre-feasibility report

title: External quality monitors for road work inspections: govt. to take services of retired engineers
content: Retired Superintending Engineers and those with not less than three years of service experience in the post of Executive Engineer are eligible to apply

title: Corporation announces pilot project to address stray dog issue
content: As a first step, 50 dogs were caught from various areas within the corporation‚Äôs borders and sterilised

title: Adapt to global changes, upskill continuously, Naidu tells students
content: Chief Minister underscores experiential learning and AI as pillars for preparing students and teachers for a rapidly evolving knowledge economy

title: Is it RTI‚Äôs turn to get murdered, asks Kharge as Economic Survey suggests a relook
content: Congress chief accuses Modi govt. of weakening the transparency law, cites pendency, vacancies and safety of activists

title: Shashi Tharoor signals loyalty to Congress amid reports that he is gravitating towards LDF
content: Thiruvananthapuram reiterates faith in Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs leadership. AICC general secretary K.C. Venugopal terms reports  of Tharoor defecting to the LDF as figment of the media‚Äôs imagination

title: US Imposes Sanctions On Top Iranian Officials After Protest Violence
content: The United States on Friday imposed fresh sanctions on Iran's Interior Minister Eskandar Momeni and several other officials, citing Tehran's violent response to recent anti-government protests.

title: Trump Says Zelensky-Putin Feud Makes Peace Efforts "Difficult"
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday noted that progress was being made toward ending the Russia-Ukraine conflict, while acknowledging that strained relations between Volodymyr Zelensky and Vladimir Putin continue to make peace efforts "difficult".

title: More Than 200 Killed In Coltan Mine Collapse In Congo
content: More than 200 people were killed this week in a collapse at the Rubaya coltan mine in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, Lumumba Kambere Muyisa, spokesperson for the rebel-appointed governor of the province where the mine is located, told Reuters.

title: Venezuela Slams US "Punitive" Measures Against Ally Cuba
content: Venezuela, whose president was recently toppled in a US military operation, on Friday slammed Washington's "punitive measures" against its struggling ally Cuba, after threats of tariffs on countries giving it oil.

title: Arab League Chief Backs US-Led Gaza Peace Board, Says "We Have To Try"
content: Arab League Secretary General Ahmed Aboul Gheit defended Arab states' decision to support the US-led Board of Peace on Gaza, saying it offered a rare opening for a ceasefire after repeated diplomatic efforts had failed to stop the fighting.

title: How Far Will He Go? Trump's Options For US Action Against Iran
content: US President Donald Trump has threatened military action against Iran over its crackdown on protesters, while still for now appearing to leave the door open for negotiations over the Islamic republic's controversial nuclear programme.

title: Saw A Lot Of Potential: VinFast Asia CEO On Setting Up EV Factory In Tamil Nadu
content: Tamil Nadu's policies have received a big thumbs up from two investors in the state, including an EV manufacturer, which said it could scout land and set up a factory in a matter of months.

title: Trump Predicts Iran Will Seek Deal To Avoid US Strikes
content: President Donald Trump predicted on Friday that Iran would seek to negotiate a deal rather than face American military action, despite Tehran warning that its arsenal of missiles would never be up for discussion.

title: Pak Opens Bidding To Privatise Islamabad, Karachi And Lahore Airports
content: Pakistan's Privatisation Commission said last week that plans to outsource operations at the country's three largest airports will now proceed through an open bidding process, citing strong interest from multiple investors.

title: 'Not A Kingmaker, I Will Win': Actor Vijay's Candid Chat With NDTV
content: Actor Vijay, whose Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) is preparing to contest the Tamil Nadu election this year, spoke to Team NDTV on Friday in his first interview with the national media since he announced his political plunge.

title: Bengaluru Real Estate Tycoon, Under Tax Scrutiny, Dies By Suicide In Office
content: A prominent real estate developer, the Confident Group has a significant presence across several southern Indian states, most notably Kerala and Karnataka.

title: Days After Threatening Strike, Trump Says Iran Wants To 'Make A Deal'
content: President Donald Trump said Thursday he believed Iran wanted to make a deal to avoid military action, adding that he had set Tehran an undisclosed deadline to respond as US ships steam towards the region.

title: Trump's Long History With Venezuela's Elite Before He Decided To Fix It
content: President Donald Trump's years-long crusade to dislodge Venezuelan strongman Nicolas Maduro, a mission he finally accomplished this month, was billed as a way to thwart drug trafficking, check migration and revive Venezuela's oil industry.

title: Shadows To Spotlight: Sunetra Pawar Set To Fill Husband's Massive Shoes
content: Even before she stepped into the powerful Pawar family through her marriage to Ajit Pawar in 1985, Sunetra Pawar, then Sunetra Patil, had politics in her bones. Her father, Bajirao Patil, was a powerful local politician and her brother followed him.

title: "Love Should Not Be Toxic, Even For Languages": Kamal Haasan On Hindi Row
content: Kamal Haasan underlined that language is just a communication device and when it comes to him, "it's my feeling, it's my expression and it's me".

title: Video Of Injured Boy Sent To Mother Before 12-Year-Old Found Dead In Delhi
content: A 12-year-old boy was found dead with grievous injuries on his body in northeast Delhi's Shastri Park area on Friday, with police suspecting his stepfather's role in the chilling case that has left his family devastated, police said.

title: Amid High Tensions, US Sanctions Iran's Top Officials Over Protest Crackdown
content: The United States on Friday announced sanctions against several Iranian officials, including the interior minister, following the deadly crackdown on anti-government protests in...

title: Amit Shah Sets "Secure Assam" Agenda In Guwahati Strategy Meet
content: In the 126-member Assam Assembly, the BJP now has 64 legislators, while its allies AGP, UPPL and BPF have nine, seven and three members, respectively.

title: PM Modi Speaks To Venezuela President, Agrees To Expand Bilateral Ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke with Venezuela's acting President Delcy Rodriguez on Friday and the two leaders agreed to take the bilateral relations to new heights in the years ahead.

title: Keep, cut or add? What to do with Sabonis, Christi...
content: the febr. 5 trade deadline is set to expire . players like Domantas Sabonis and deandre Ayton are not living up to the hype . there are some smaller names of players heating up and bigger names of guys struggling or not fitting in with their teams .

title: Operation Trashi-I enters Day 13; internet suspended in J&K's Kishtwar
content: a joint team of security forces continued combing the forests in the snowbound Chatroo belt in the Kishtwar district to track and kill holed-up ultras . as a precautionary measure, district authorities suspended mobile internet services temporarily in the region . a fresh counter-terrorism operation was launched in Pajja Morh, Nabana Top, and adjoining areas in Surankote, Poonch district . no contact had yet been established with the suspects, and the operation was ongoing,

title: WWE 'SmackDown': Live results and analysis
content: The WWE heads to Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, for the last episode of "SmackDown" before Saturday's Royal Rumble. With an upcoming Undisputed WWE Championship match between Drew McIntyre and Sami Zayn coming up on Saturday, the two wrestlers will meet face-to-face. Cody Rhodes made his return to "SmackDown" where he predicted another Royal Rumble victory to a mixed reaction from the crowd. Earlier on "SmackDown," Carmelo Hayes defended his United States Championship against Rey Fenix in an open challenge match. In the main event, The Vision will challenge Zayn, Rhodes, Jey Uso and Randy Orton. Arda Ocal breaks down all the action from "SmackDown" in Riyadh.

title: The Premier League stars who could still move this...
content: there is just under a week to go in the transfer window, so the clock is ticking for premier league clubs and players to make their moves . there are a number of players out there who still need to move before the window shuts on febr. 2 . if they've been ostracized from their club, asked for a move, got tangled up in difficult contractual circumstances, or simply need minutes ahead of the 2026 world cup, here are the major names in the premier league .

title: Gold or bust? X factors for all 12 men's Olympic h...
content: team USA is on the cusp of a true best-on-best international hockey tournament . Connor McDavid , Auston Matthews , Mikko Rantanen , Leon Draisaitl , David Pastrnak have all been superstars in the NHL for the better part of 10 years . that changes in the next fortnight .

title: Dominant Bayern fall short of Leverkusen perfectio...
content: jamal Musiala scored on his first start since returning from injury . bayer leverkusen social media team had doubtless been waiting for the moment to pounce . Xabi Alonso's double winners in 2023-24 campaign unbeaten .

title: Lopez-Stevenson picks: Can power crack Shakur's de...
content: Teofimo Lopez will put his WBO junior welterweight title on the line against Shakur Stevenson at Madison Square Garden in new york . the former unified lightweight champion is the fourth defense of the belt he won with a unanimous decision over Josh Taylor .

title: Behind the scenes at Driveline: How the lab that g...
content: 16 broken baseball bats hang on a wall inside driveline's 15,000-square-foot facility . the broken bats are a badge of honor -- a symbol of work done with requisite intensity . Edgar Quero, 22, stepped into a batting cage just a few feet away .
